page.title: 10HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: The Augustinian Priory was founded in 1189 near Burscough but only it's site remains. There are several C.17 houses in the town, one of which was called " God's Providence " when the occupants escaped the plague. Parts of some C.18th coaching inns and other Georgian buildings can still be seen mainly on Burscough street. The original Town Hall built in 1779 still stand in Church Street. There are many Victorian buildings in the area. The Agricultural Club was the old Dispensary and Brandreth Hospital was the original cottage hospital. Derby Street retains many of it's Victorian buildings including the Sessions House. On the site of the old market cross lies the Clock Tower and opposite the bus station there is a statue of Disraeli.
